message.content:
To get the directory location of a symbolic link in Python, you can use the `os` and `os.path` modules. Here's how you can do it:

```python
import os

# Assuming 'symlink_path' is the path to your symbolic link
symlink_path = '/path/to/your/symlink'

# Get the directory of the symbolic link
symlink_dir = os.path.dirname(symlink_path)

print(f"The directory of the symbolic link is: {symlink_dir}")
```

This code snippet will return the directory where the symbolic link resides, not the directory that the symbolic link points to. If you need the target directory that the symbolic link points to, you can use the following approach:

```python
import os

# Assuming 'symlink_path' is the path to your symbolic link
symlink_path = '/path/to/your/symlink'

# Get the target path of the symbolic link
target_path = os.readlink(symlink_path)

# Get the directory of the target path
target_dir = os.path.dirname(target_path)

print(f"The directory that the symbolic link points to is: {target_dir}")
```

This will give you the directory of the target path that the symbolic link is pointing to.

@EOF@
[symbolic link, directory location, Python, os module, os.path.dirname, os.readlink, target path, symlink_path]
